titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I received the Holy Communion at 8 a.m.: attended Mattins & Evensong: worked at the C.T. sermon: walked with Lillingston: wrote letters.
I wrote to the Bishop of Manchester suggesting that it might be sound policy to advance a public demand for a Royal Commission on the Relations of Church & State.
After dinner I read "The Pickwick Papers" aloud to my family. The little obituary notice on Addis, which I wrote at his brother's request appeared in the "Morning Post" of yesterday.
